alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 6:24AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...MOOSE GLACIER DAMMED LAKE IS RELEASING AND COULD CAUSE HIGH WATER IN KENAI LAKE AND COOPER LANDING AREA... WHAT: There is reason to believe the Moose Glacier Dammed Lake (GDL) has begun releasing. WHERE: Biggest impacts at Snow River leading into Kenai Lake and downstream into the Kenai River and the Cooper Landing area. WHEN: Using a fall 2015 release as an analog, estimates on the Snow River are expected to peak on Sunday, September 10th around 10:00 AM AKDT at 13 ft. We expect Cooper landing to crest Sunday night, September 10th around 10 PM AKDT at 13 ft. POTENTIAL IMPACTS: - Cooper Landing: Quartz Creek Campground boat ramp submerged and water encroaches campsites that are located next to the lake. North Cooper Creek Campgrounds begins to flood. - Snow River leading into Kenai Lake: Minor flooding at Primrose Campground. PREPAREDNESS: There is a lot of uncertainty with this event as this particular GDL does not release regularly. Please monitor local river levels and forecasts for the latest updates.

area.areaDesc: Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound
